timeline.bodyText:
Including subset of clusters to monitor instead of ClusterManagerHostHealthEvaluator's all running clusters.
Also one corner case was not covered in existing flow related to "PENDING" cluster deleted in CB.
timeline.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText:
I may be missing something here.
What sends a 'Periscope Cluster' into the SUSPENDED or PENDING state?
ClusterCreationEvaluator seems to be the one setting state to 'PENDING' when it first pulls in a cluster.
The only place that seems to move a cluster into SUSPENDED state is UpdateFailedeHandler.
The UpdateFailedHandler will only be invoked by YarnLoadEvaluator (which we can ignore since LoadAlerts may not be enabled for a cluster) or ClusterStateEvaluator, which will only be invoked based on this 'getMonitored' list.
Won't we need to look up pretty much all clusters here?
Also, didn't understand the need for "RUNNING" + scalingEnabled=false. Why not RUNNING + scalingEnabled=true (which goes back to the previous point about monitoring all clusters).
replies.author: sidseth

replies.bodyText: Ideally RUNNING + scalingEnabled=true would not be required since it would be tested while in their autoscale runs, but realized CronTimeEvaluator does not check if Cluster is online.  Fixed it.
replies.author: smaniraju

replies.bodyText: Even if the LoadEvaluator made this change - this particular component should not be making any assumptions about the actual triggers. It is a mechanism to keep cluster state in sync with Cloudbreak, and should behave independently of other components - which I think the latest commit does.
replies.author: sidseth
